comments:
import ant.ui and ant.core into workspace. create a new JUnit test in ant.ui (something like assertTrue
(true)), ensure projects are built, make ant.core depend on ant.ui in plugin.xml, launch your junit test

Same problem exists in 3.0. Good bug, but not a regression :-)

Fixed in JavaRuntime. Used a ThreadLocal to cache list of already resolved 
projects to avoid cycles when resolving container classpath entries.
